quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Mercury and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, computers, network. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can you put movies and TV shows on your iPod?
What does ADSL stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asymmetrical Digital Subscriber Line

questions.question: Which of the following is best suited for network cable that must run close to electrical lines or florescent lighting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiber optic cable

questions.question: Which of these Siemens models has a built-in camera?
Which of these commands will return a Windows® computers node IP address, Subnet mask and information on whether it was assigned via DHCP and how long the lease is?
What was the first spacecraft to study the planet Mercury?
If your cell phone runs out of power, this gadget will come to the rescue. Just plug it into your mobile phones charging port and turn the crank.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: SOS Charger

questions.question: When you ping a network node, which protocol is being utilized?
You will need this type for memory card, if you want to expand yout Nokia 7710.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MMC Card

questions.question: How many songs do 80 gigabyte iPods hold up to?
What is the diameter of planet Mercury?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4,878 km / 3 031 miles

questions.question: This device is pretty useful if you have to walk a mile in the dark.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mobile LED Light

questions.question: Mercury was named after the Roman Messenger of the gods. What is the name of the corresponding god in Greek mythology?
All iPods come in one and the same shape.
Which of the following is not a level 4 (Transport Layer) network protocol?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Pearls and Mercury
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, iridescence, mercury. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the mean temperature on the surface of Mercury?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 333 degrees Fahrenheit / 167 degrees Celsius

questions.question: How long does it take for the planet Mercury to orbit the Sun once?
Which of these methods is a reliable way to distinguish a natural pearl from a cultured one and a fake one?

options.text: Rubbing the pearl on ones teeth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What element comprises more than half of Mercurys mass?
Which of these pearls are the most valuable in the world?

options.text: Natural pearls with the most unusual shapes
Natural pearls that are perfectly spherical

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natural pearls that are perfectly spherical

questions.question: The largest known impact crater on Mercury is named what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caloris Basin

questions.question: Pearls come in many shapes and sizes. What term refers to pearls with irregular shapes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baroque pearls

questions.question: What is the name of the largest known pearl on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Mercury has a moon called Celsius.
The iridescence of pearls depends on the number and thickness of the nacre layers. Which of these combinations provides the most iridescent pearl?

options.text: A large number of layers that are as thin as possible
Many layers that are as thick as possible
A small number of layers that are very thick
Fewer layers that are very thin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A large number of layers that are as thin as possible

questions.question: What is the most abundant element in Mercurys atmosphere?
A pearl can be produced naturally by almost any shelled mollusk. What triggers the process of pearl formation?

options.text: Changes in the chemical composition of the water.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irritant particles

questions.question: From our point of view on Earth, Mercury goes through different phases, just like our Moon.
What kind of pearls are the so-called Keshi pearls?

options.text: Very rare natural pearls found only in one place on the planet.
Cultured pearls that are very large and precious
Fake pearls that are almost indistinguishable from natural pearls
Pearls that are produced accidentally, but are not considered natural

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearls that are produced accidentally, but are not considered natural

questions.question: What is the basic chemical compound that natural pearls consist of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calcium carbonate

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Vitamin and Group
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, b1, places. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The folic acid, a compound especially important during periods of rapid cell division and growth, is commercially known under what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B9

questions.question: The B vitamins group was once thought to be a single vitamin. There are now eight officially recognized B vitamins referred to as vitamin B complex. Which of the following is not a vitamin from the B group?
Vitamin B2 has which of these interesting properties?

options.text: It is can be absorbed only through the skin.
It can be found in all three physical conditions of matter.
It is fluorescent under UV light.
It melts at more than 10 000 degrees C.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is fluorescent under UV light.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the sources of vitamin B5?

options.text: It is found only in plant products.
It is synthesized in the skin under the influence of the sun rays.
It is found only in animal products.
It is found in a large variety of foods.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is found in a large variety of foods.

questions.question: Vitamin B6 is widely distributed in foods and its relatively stable form enables it to remain unchanged even when the products are cooked.
Vitamin B12 is a set of complex chemical compounds synthesized in nature only by this group of organisms.
Which is the only B vitamin that cannot be obtained from plant products?
The vitamins from the B complex have many functions but generally play most important role in which of these processes of the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cell metabolism

questions.question: To which of these groups of substances do the B vitamins belong?
In which of these places natural pearl hunting on a large scale has survived until modern times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australia and Bahrain

questions.question: Which of these is not among the systems of the human body that vitamins of the B group mainly benefit?
B1, a vitamin participating in many important cellular processes, is synthesized by animals, plants and some bacteria.
This vitamin of the B complex, popular also under the name vitamin H, is not included in the recommended daily intake by some health organizations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B7

questions.question: In which of these unusual colors can natural pearls come?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Niacin, also known as vitamin B3 or nicotinic acid, is a vitamin that can be synthesized by which organ?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Number and Atomic Number
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, lack, ricin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What atomic number does Calcium have?
In what part of the apple are the toxic compounds cyanogenic glycosides found?
The atomic number of Argon is 19.

Megaloblastic anemia is a type of anemia in which among the bone marrows red blood cells start to appear many immature and dysfunctional ones. The deficiency of which two vitamins of the B complex group causes this disorder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: B9 and B12

questions.question: Which of these is the correct atomic number of the chemical element Radon?
Which of these is the correct atomic number of the chemical element Actinium?
Which of these medical conditions is caused by the ricin found in castor beans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Oxygens atomic number is 8.
What is the atomic number of Neon?
What was the star at the center of the Solar System called by the Romans?
The atomic number of the chemical element Tin is 50.
The fruit of the poisonous Jerusalem cherry is very similar to which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherry tomato

questions.question: The atomic number of Zinc is 52.
What type of medical problems does the consumption of raw seeds of the Common bean commonly cause?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gastric problems

questions.question: Biotin deficiency (the lack of vitamin B7) is a rare nutritional disorder that occurs in people from this age group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Mars and Sun
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, voyager, average. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On average, how long is the sunspot cycle?
What is the average temperature on the Martian surface?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: -23 degrees Celsius

questions.question: Olympus Mons lies on Mars.
The Sun orbits a center of mass.
Which statement about the atmosphere Mars is true?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these parts of the Sun is the warmest?
Did Voyager obtain the first images of Mars?
The Sun has how many times the diameter of the Earth?
Which of these is the surface temperature of the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9950 Degrees Fahrenheit

questions.question: Is Phobos a satellite of Mars?
How many Earth masses is the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 330,000 Earth masses

questions.question: Valles Marineris is a polar rift on the surface of Mars.
Which of the listed NASA probes made the closest approach to the Sun?
How long is a day on the planet Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24.6 Earth hours

questions.question: What is the size of Mars compared to the size of Earth.

options.text: The two planets can not be compared.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars is smaller than Earth.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Vitamin and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, mangoes, carotenoids. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is a major source of iron, which helps carry oxygen to the tissues?
This vitamin, known as pantothenic acid, is found in some hair and skin care products.
Niacin, also known as vitamin B3, is required for healthy hair.
How long does it take Mars to complete one revolution around the sun?
Apricots contain carotenoids and antioxidants that may help to prevent heart disease.
Figs are a natural source of potassium and carbohydrates.
Skimmed milk contains riboflavin (vitamin B2), vitamin A and calcium.
Mangoes are high in prebiotic dietary fiber and vitamin C.
Which of these is said to be helpful in reducing swelling from bee stings?
Shellfish is rich in vitamin B12, which supports the functions of nerves and mental ability.
What is the name of the six-wheeled robotic vehicle of the Pathfinder Mission on Mars?
Which of these is present in lentils?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Walnuts contain only unsaturated fats and therefore decrease the risk of heart disease.
Which of the following is a water soluble vitamin also known as riboflavin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B2

questions.question: Which of these fish is a major source of omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these
